column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=( ( WN ) ) The British Parliament voted against military intervention in Syria , do you think this has affected their relations with the United States ?
#Text=SL : No — had the Obama Administration been united and decisive for intervention , there might have been some effect .
#Text=But the Obama Administration 's divisions mean its first priority is getting some coherence in Washington , rather than blaming London .
#Text=MR : I do n't think so .
#Text=I believe that [ the ]
#Text=UK has been [ the ] staunchest ally of the United States for decades .
#Text=One instance of opposing parliamentary vote will not have impact on US-UK relations .
#Text=EZ : Maybe .
#Text=But Britain is not an important power any more , so the affect will be only in the symbolic field .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Russian President Vladimir Putin has said Russia could back Syrian intervention if there was conclusive proof of regime guilt .
#Text=What sort of evidence would be needed and can this level of assurance be given ?
#Text=SL : This is not a scientific question — we already have extensive evidence establishing the near-certainty of major regime attacks with chemical weapons on 7 towns on August 21 .

#Text=Putin 's statement was a political move : it ostensibly re-confirmed the Russian opposition to US intervention while giving Moscow a way to step back if the UN inspectors return a damning report .
#Text=MR : It is difficult , if not impossible , to provide Moscow with the evidence that they are looking for .
#Text=In order to provide that specific information several criterions should be met .
#Text=First of all , the soil of the location where the alleged chemical weapons are used , should immediately be examined after the incident .
#Text=The Syrian government has not allowed immediate access to these places and usually reports come out days after .
#Text=Second , and more fundamentally , a concrete and observable evidence is needed for Russia showing that Assad 's government has used it as opposed to the rebels .
#Text=EZ : No the Russians are not after the truth but after their interests even if Assad admits that he used such weapon the Russians will be against any intervention .
#Text=Bombed out vehicles in Aleppo during the Syrian civil war .
#Text=Image : Voice of America .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Would US military intervention on Syria be a violation of International law ?
#Text=SL : This is a grey area , especially as there will not be an endorsement by the United Nations Security Council .
#Text=Supporters of the action say it can be justified under the recent doctrine of humanitarian intervention , but that is more a political rather than legal judgement .
#Text=MR : Legally speaking , it is [ in ] violation of [ the ] United Nations Charter .
#Text=According to [ the ] UN Charter , use of force is permitted only in case of self-defense or UNSC 's [ United Nations Security Council ] approval .
#Text=Neither of these two cases apply for US use of military force against Syria .
#Text=However , this does not mean that our current international law is devoid of any shortcomings .
#Text=The International system has some shortcomings because of the structure of the UNSC , where one member can veto a resolution and block actions .
#Text=EZ : Technically — yes because they did not get an approval from the UN .
